data.title: Cadence System Design and Analysis on LinkedIn: Seamless ECAD
data.meta_description: Michael Jackson, Cadence Design Systems VP of Research and Development, shares the stage at 3DEXPERIENCE World with SOLIDWORKS CEO Manish Kumar as theyâ€¦
data.text:
Our live Q&A is back! If you have pressing questions about designing or making PCBs comment them below. John Burkhert is here to answer them all! #PCBdesign #PCBassembly

Learn how to navigate OrCAD X easily through shortcut keys. In this video you will learn how to customize your shortcut keys and how they can make your life as a designer easier. https://bit.ly/4cIfzVS #OrCADX #Cadence

Component vendor lists can look like a grab bag of random shapes and sizes â€“ learn the difference and motivation between different component package types. https://bit.ly/3KVWzaC #PCBdesign #Cadence

Discover the world of LVDS signals: high-speed, low-power, and low-noise differential signaling. Learn about its advantages, voltage levels, and unique features! https://bit.ly/4eAZjrx #PCBdesign #Cadence

Unleash the Power of IC Packaging: From Protecting Chips to Revolutionizing Integration! Explore traditional types, advanced techniques, and emerging trends in this electrifying journey. https://bit.ly/3VXO4C3 #PCBdesign #Cadence

Unlock the full potential of RF CMOS layouts! Discover essential guidelines for optimal performance in analog circuits, including symmetry, grounding, and noise immunity. https://bit.ly/3xp71V0 #PCBdesign #Cadence

Register Now! ðŸ‘‰ Join us on July 24 at 12:10pm PDT for an insightful session with John Park on the evolving role of #EDA as chips transform into 3D systems. Learn more about this upcoming event: https://lnkd.in/g5G2Vn3W

Which placement option is best, image A or B? Click this link to leave your answer! https://bit.ly/4f6v6AL #allegroX #PCBdesign #Cadence

Are you interested in trialing the AWR design environment? Read this quick guide to learn how you can easily sign up for the free trial. https://bit.ly/3yOR9LN #AWR #Cadence

In PCB design is is common to copy an object and then use it for a keepout or constraint region. OrCAD X allows designers easily accomplish this with the Paste Special command. https://bit.ly/3ziVHKE #Cadence #OrCADX
